meanings.definition: A musical composition for a funeral Mass.
meanings.sent1: The choir sang requiems at the funeral to honor the deceased.
meanings.sent2: The requiems played softly in the background as people paid their respects.
meanings.sent3: The requiems echoed through the church, bringing a sense of peace to the mourners.
meanings.sent4: The requiems seemed to carry the souls of the departed to a place of eternal rest.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the requiems lingered in the air long after the service ended.

meanings.definition: A Mass for the repose of the souls of the dead.
meanings.sent1: The priest conducted a requiems to pray for the souls of the departed.
meanings.sent2: Attending the requiems brought solace to those grieving the loss of loved ones.
meanings.sent3: During the requiems, the candles flickered as if the spirits were present.
meanings.sent4: The requiems enveloped the congregation in a sense of divine peace and comfort.
meanings.sent5: The solemn atmosphere of the requiems touched the hearts of all who attended.

meanings.definition: Any musical service, hymn, or dirge for the repose of the dead.
meanings.sent1: The community came together to sing requiems in memory of those who had passed away.
meanings.sent2: The requiems filled the church with a sense of reverence and remembrance.
meanings.sent3: Despite the somber occasion, the requiems brought a sense of unity and hope.
meanings.sent4: The requiems served as a poignant reminder of the fragility of life.
meanings.sent5: The haunting beauty of the requiems touched the hearts of all who listened.
